qas.question: Which Mac is known for improving the handling of color graphics?
Who did Apple pay expensive consulting fees to before doing in-house work?
What was established for bringing Apple's design work in-house?
Who was responsible for crafting a new look for all Apple products?
How did the Mac System 7 improve multitasking?
Which Mac is known for improving the handling of non-color graphics?
Who did Microsoft pay expensive consulting fees to before doing in-house work?
What was established for bringing Microsoft's design work in-house?
Who was responsible for crafting a new look for all Microsoft products?
How did the Mac System 6 improve multitasking?

context: As for <a0_0><b5_0>Mac OS, System 7<b5_0/><a0_0/> was a 32-bit rewrite from Pascal to C++ that introduced virtual memory and improved the handling of color graphics, as well as memory addressing, networking, and <a4_0><b9_0>co-operative multitasking<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Also during this time, the Macintosh began to shed the "Snow White" design language, along with the expensive consulting fees they were paying to <a1_0><b6_0>Frogdesign<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Apple instead brought the design work in-house by establishing <a2_0>the <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>Apple Industrial Design Group<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/><a2_0/>, becoming responsible for crafting a new look for all Apple products.
